CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper March 2, 1957, pg. 2, reads: "Entrance to Large-Family Shelter - One of the many children in the two double structures on Western Ave. stands on the porch of one of the run-down buildings. Several of the large families have been given notice to move. Note one of many windows in the structures boarded up with cardboard. Doors leading to front hall stay open winter and summer since there are no panes in them. Window beside one with cardboard has been recently patched. Many large families are forced to live in places through the city as bad or worse than this one. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Four children looking through broken window of dilapidated multi-family brick building, Western Avenue, Northside
